output:
One-Day Meal Plan for Athlete (Lactose-Free, Budget-Conscious)

Estimated Daily Caloric Needs: ~3,000-3,300 calories
Macronutrient Breakdown:
- Protein: 180-200g
- Carbohydrates: 350-400g
- Healthy Fats: 80-100g

MEAL PLAN:

Breakfast (700 calories):
- 4 egg whites + 2 whole eggs scrambled
- 1 cup oatmeal with banana and almonds
- 1 scoop plant-based protein powder
- Water with multivitamin

Mid-Morning Snack (300 calories):
- Homemade protein energy balls (oats, peanut butter, honey, protein powder)
- Apple

Lunch (650 calories):
- 6 oz grilled chicken breast
- Brown rice (1 cup)
- Roasted mixed vegetables
- Olive oil dressing

Pre-Workout Snack (250 calories):
- Rice cakes
- Almond butter
- Banana

Post-Workout Meal (700 calories):
- 8 oz lean ground turkey
- Sweet potato
- Steamed broccoli
- Coconut milk-based sauce

Evening Snack (400 calories):
- Tuna
- Whole grain crackers
- Mixed nuts

Hydration: 3-4 liters of water throughout the day

Budget-Friendly Tips:
- Buy in bulk
- Use frozen vegetables
- Choose affordable protein sources
- Prepare meals in advance

output:
One-Day Meal Plan for Ultra-Marathon Mountain Runner

Athlete Profile:
- Height: 182 cm
- Weight: 78 kg
- Goal: Ultra-Endurance Performance
- Dietary Restrictions: Gluten-free, Dairy-free

Total Daily Calorie Target: Approximately 3,500-4,000 calories
Macronutrient Breakdown:
- Carbohydrates: 55-60%
- Protein: 20-25%
- Healthy Fats: 20-25%

Meal Plan:

Breakfast (750 calories):
- Quinoa porridge with almond milk
- Mixed berries and sliced almonds
- Chia seeds
- Plant-based protein powder
- Coconut oil drizzle
- Green tea

Mid-Morning Snack (300 calories):
- Banana
- Almond butter
- Rice cake
- Electrolyte water

Lunch (800 calories):
- Grilled chicken breast
- Sweet potato
- Roasted mixed vegetables
- Olive oil
- Himalayan salt
- Avocado slices

Pre-Training Snack (300 calories):
- Gluten-free energy bar
- Dates
- Coconut water

Post-Training Recovery Meal (650 calories):
- Salmon
- Quinoa
- Steamed broccoli
- Olive oil
- Lemon
- Pumpkin seeds

Evening Snack (400 calories):
- Mixed nuts
- Dried fruit
- Gluten-free protein shake with plant-based protein

Hydration:
- 4-5 liters of water
- Electrolyte supplements

Key Nutritional Considerations:
- High complex carbohydrates
- Lean proteins
- Anti-inflammatory foods
- Gluten-free grains
- Dairy-free alternatives
- Electrolyte replacement

Supplements:
- Omega-3
- Vitamin D
- Magnesium
- Electrolyte complex

Notes:
- Adjust portion sizes based on training intensity
- Emphasize whole, nutrient-dense foods
- Monitor individual tolerance and performance

output:
Here's a one-day meal plan tailored for an endurance cyclist with vegan, gluten-free, and no processed sugar requirements:

NUTRITIONAL PROFILE:
- Estimated Daily Calories: 3,200-3,500
- Macronutrient Breakdown:
  * Protein: 25-30%
  * Carbohydrates: 50-55%
  * Healthy Fats: 20-25%

MEAL PLAN:

🌅 BREAKFAST (7:00 AM)
- Quinoa porridge with chia seeds
- Mixed berries (blueberries, raspberries)
- Almond butter
- Hemp protein powder smoothie
- Coconut water

Nutritional Focus: Complex carbs, protein, antioxidants for recovery

🥗 MID-MORNING SNACK (10:00 AM)
- Sweet potato and spinach energy bites
- Homemade green smoothie (kale, banana, spirulina)

Nutritional Focus: Sustained energy, electrolyte replenishment

🍽️ LUNCH (12:30 PM)
- Lentil and roasted vegetable buddha bowl
- Avocado
- Pumpkin seeds
- Tahini dressing
- Kombucha

Nutritional Focus: Protein, complex carbs, healthy fats

🏋️ PRE-WORKOUT (3:00 PM)
- Brown rice cake with almond butter
- Banana
- Electrolyte drink with natural sea salt

Nutritional Focus: Quick energy, muscle preparation

🚴 POST-WORKOUT RECOVERY (5:30 PM)
- Tempeh and vegetable stir-fry
- Quinoa
- Turmeric-ginger sauce
- Coconut water

Nutritional Focus: Protein synthesis, inflammation reduction

🌙 DINNER (7:30 PM)
- Black bean and sweet potato patties
- Roasted Brussels sprouts
- Cauliflower rice
- Nutritional yeast
- Olive oil drizzle

Nutritional Focus: Muscle repair, nutrient density

🌿 EVENING SNACK (9:00 PM)
- Chia seed pudding
- Mixed nuts
- Herbal recovery tea

Nutritional Focus: Slow-release protein, muscle recovery

HYDRATION:
- Water intake: 3-4 liters throughout the day
- Electrolyte supplementation

SUPPLEMENT RECOMMENDATIONS:
- Vegan protein powder
- B12
- Omega-3 (algae-based)
- Vitamin D
- Zinc

KEY CONSIDERATIONS:
- Gluten-free grains: Quinoa, rice
- Plant-based proteins: Lentils, tempeh, beans
- Natural energy sources
- Anti-inflammatory ingredients

MEAL PREP TIPS:
- Batch cook grains and proteins
- Prepare energy bites in advance
- Use glass containers for storage

This meal plan provides:
- Sustained energy
- Muscle recovery support
- Nutrient-dense whole foods
- Meets vegan and gluten-free requirements
- No processed sugars

DISCLAIMER: Consult a registered dietitian for personalized nutrition advice.
